statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Damon Stoudamire scored 14 of his 29 points in the period as Portland beat the Los Angeles Clippers 113-93 on Saturday night.
article.headline: Stoudamire scores 14 of his 29 in decisive third

images.name: Stoudamire, Damon 020119 inline
images.caption: Damon Stoudamire helped the Blazers open a 38-point lead in the third quarter.

article.linkText: Blazers ride huge third quarter to fifth win in six games
article.story:
PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Damon Stoudamire took over in the third quarter for the Portland Trail Blazers. Stoudamire scored 14 of his 29 points in the period as Portland beat the Los Angeles Clippers 113-93 on Saturday night. He shot 5-of-6 in the third -- including 4-of-5 from 3-point distance -- as Portland went up by as many as 38 points in the quarter, thanks to a 29-7 run at the start. "Damon played great for us. Damon's our man right now," Bonzi Wells said. "Damon really opened the defense up for us and spread the floor. Everybody was making the extra pass. That's what team basketball is all about." Ruben Patterson added 19 points and five rebounds, Scottie Pippen and Wells each scored 13, Rasheed Wallace 12 and Shawn Kemp 10 for the Trail Blazers. Pippen also had a game-high nine assists. "Tonight we just came out and took it to them right from the beginning," Stoudamire said. "I wanted to come out and establish myself early, and I was able to do that." Darius Miles scored a season-high 20 points, and Quentin Richardson added 19 points and six rebounds to lead the Clippers, who fell to 3-14 on the road. "We don't have any intensity on the road," Miles said. "I'm one of the players that's supposed to come off the bench and bring intensity, so I feel like it's my fault." Los Angeles was without forward Lamar Odom, who sat out with a sore right wrist. Corey Maggette started in his place and scored 11 points and had four rebounds. "They shot the ball very well," Clippers coach Alvin Gentry said. "More so than anything, you have to give them credit for playing well. When they play at a high level like they played tonight, they can beat anyone." Shooting percentage was what set the teams apart as Portland shot 54.2 percent, while the Clippers were at just 37 percent. "Our shooting was phenomenal," Portland coach Maurice Cheeks said. "We swung the ball from one side to the other. When you do that, you make shots." Elton Brand struggled against Portland, finishing with just nine points and five rebounds. "We don't want to make excuses," Brand said. "We didn't come out to play. We've got to learn to play on the road." Portland, which lost to Los Angeles on Jan. 1, began to pull away in the first half behind Pippen's 10 first-quarter points and cruised the rest of the way. "What they did you to you, that put's a nasty taste in your mouth," Wells said. "It was a bad taste New Year's Day. They beat us, and we wanted to make a statement that we are better than we were on New Year's." The Clippers were undone by poor shooting early -- 30.4 percent in the first quarter, and 35.4 percent for the half. Michael Olowokandi shot just 1-of-10, with many of his misses coming from close-range. He finished the game 2-of-11 with seven points and seven rebounds. Portland on the other hand, shot 60 percent in the first quarter, and 53.5 percent for the half. "Defensively, we played well which allowed us to get into the open court," Pippen said. "It was important for us to win tonight." Stoudamire scored 11 of his 15 first half-points in the second quarter as Portland increased its lead to as many as 18.

Game notes
Portland improved to 114-47 against the Clippers overall, and 69-12 in Portland. ... The Blazers have won 20-of-21 in Portland against Los Angeles. ... Portland is 10-1 when scoring more than 100 points. ... The Clippers are just 9-13 against Western Conference teams. ... The last time the Clippers won in Portland was April 11, 1999. ... Obina Ekezie scored a season-high seven points for Los Angeles.
